nodes.bodyText: This interface (unlike ConnectorMetadata) is entirely internal to Presto. You can directly change the old createView method instead of adding a new one.
As discussed, undo changes from this file

the default implementation should call the other version of createView().  Also, as discussed

mark that other one as deprecated
implement this version for all the connectors in Presto that had implemented the other one.
this code should never be called. throw an IllegalStateException
view metadata should never be null, so we can simplify this
use ImmutableSet.of() to create an empty hashSet

Also, actually, maybe instead of calling getColumnHandles, call the type translator directly on the ColumnMetadata, since all we need from it is the type translation.
Something like
List<Column> columns = viewColumnMetadata.stream()
    .map(column-> new Column(column.getName, toHiveType(typeTranslator, column.getType(), column.getComment())
    .collect(toImmutableList())
I don't think these changes are needed.  getBucketProperty isn't called by getColumnHandles().  (and also, suggested not calling getColumnHandles() anyway)

ConnectorTableMetadata includes the SchemaTableName, so you don't need both.
Either make the signature:
createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, List<ColumnMetadata> columnMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)
or make it more similar to createTable() like
createView(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableMetadata viewMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)
remove the dummyColumn
Why do we even need 2 methods? It feels like we should simply migrate.
I think we should have a deprecation period since this is an spi change in case there are external connectors that need to migrate.

We are trying to do our best to do not make any breaking changes, however I'm not sure if the delay is going to be really helpful. But from the other side it will make the SPI more messy. Anyhow, I don't have a strong opinion here. We can keep the old SPI method.
That's fair.  People can just as easily wait to upgrade until they fix their connectors.  @ucalegon206, let's remove the deprecated method entirely

Nit: Extract viewMetadata.getTable() as a variable to reuse since it's called a lot of times.  something like
SchemaTableName viewName = viewMetadata.getTable();
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1671,14 +1678,16 @@ public void createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, Strin
                 .put(PRESTO_QUERY_ID_NAME, session.getQueryId())
                 .build();
 
-        Column dummyColumn = new Column("dummy", HIVE_STRING, Optional.empty());
+        List<Column> columns = viewMetadata.getColumns().stream()
+                .map(col -> new Column(col.getName(), toHiveType(typeTranslator, col.getType()), Optional.ofNullable(col.getComment())))
+                        .collect(toImmutableList());
 
         Table.Builder tableBuilder = Table.builder()
-                .setDatabaseName(viewName.getSchemaName())
-                .setTableName(viewName.getTableName())
+                .setDatabaseName(viewMetadata.getTable().getSchemaName())

nodes.bodyText: LOL, yeah... this really makes sense. Thanks for catching it.

                 .put(PRESTO_QUERY_ID_NAME, session.getQueryId())
                 .build();
 
-        Column dummyColumn = new Column("dummy", HIVE_STRING, Optional.empty());
+        List<Column> columns = viewMetadata.getColumns().stream()
+                .map(col -> new Column(col.getName(), toHiveType(typeTranslator, col.getType()), Optional.ofNullable(col.getComment())))
+                        .collect(toImmutableList());
 
         Table.Builder tableBuilder = Table.builder()
-                .setDatabaseName(viewName.getSchemaName())
-                .setTableName(viewName.getTableName())
+                .setDatabaseName(viewMetadata.getTable().getSchemaName())

nodes.bodyText: nit: undo change to this file
nit: call this columnMetadata (lower case d) since everywhere else "metadata" is considered one word
nodes.diffHunk:

                 .map(field -> new ViewColumn(field.getName().get(), field.getType()))
                 .collect(toImmutableList());
 
+        List<ColumnMetadata> columnMetaData = columns.stream()

nodes.bodyText: throw an IllegalStateException for the deprecated version since it should never be called.
this version should call the deprecated version by default
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -499,7 +499,16 @@ default void finishDelete(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableHandle tableHa
     /**
      * Create the specified view. The data for the view is opaque to the connector.
      */
+    @Deprecated
     default void createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, String viewData, boolean replace)
+    {
+        createView(session, (ConnectorTableMetadata) null, viewData, replace);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Create the specified view. The data for the view is opaque to the connector.
+     */
+    default void createView(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableMetadata viewMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)

nodes.bodyText: Ah yes. Thank you.

nodes.bodyText: this version should throw the exception by default
Ok, I didn't catch that. Would this work for you? throw new IllegalStateException("Deprecated createView method call");

no, this should be the original exception it was throwing about unsupported views.  the basic flow is we call the new method, if it's not overridden we call the old method, if that isn't overridden we say views aren't supported.
nit: move this above where data is set, so this is right next to the columnMetadata creation and the createView() arguments are created in the order they appear.
You should simply remove this method. It has a default implementation in the interface that throws an UnsupportedOperationException.  Same for other connectors.
Ditto. Simply remove it.
This should also be removed. It is never called by the engine.
